brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether differences in the gene coding for the
      liver enzyme carboxylesterase 1 (CES1) means differences in the metabolism of
      methylphenidate, a CES1 dependent drug.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of CES1 Genotype on Metabolism of Methylphenidate

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  > 18 years old

          -  Caucasian

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Chronic disease (except hay fever and eczema)

          -  Pregnancy

          -  Smoking

          -  High level of alcohol consumption (> 21 units per week for men and 14 for women)

          -  Known allergy towards methylphenidate

          -  Permanent use of medication (contraception ok)

intervention.description: 10 mg as a single dose followed by one blood sample 3 hours post-dose

facility.name: Department of Clinical Pharmacology, Bispebjerg University Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Impact of CES1 Genotype on Metabolism of Methylphenidate

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Clinical Pharmacology, Bispebjerg University Hospital

primary_outcome.description: We are looking at the ratio of methylphenidate to ritalinic acid (metabolite) 3 hours post-dose as a measure of CES1 activity.
primary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration of methylphenidate and ritalinic acid

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Three samples for each participant during the trials (as indicated above). Metabolomics will be assessed with focus on lipids (lipid platform) and with use of usual concentration measures (eg nanomolar (nM))

collaborator.agency: Ministry of Science, Innovation and Higher Education (Denmark)
The Leiden Academic Center for Drug Research (LACDR)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science
